#Text=Jerome
#Text=Anderson ( football agent )
#Text=This article is about the association football sports agent .
#Text=For the professional basketball player , see Jerome Anderson ( basketball ) .
#Text=Jerome Anderson
#Text=was a London-based sports agent with Sport Entertainment and Media Group from 2001 until his retirement .

#Text=Initially focused on the football world , he extended his reach into heavyweight boxing and was Lennox Lewis ' agent for his bout against Mike Tyson that was described by The Telegraph as one of “ the moments of the decade . ” [ 1 ]

#Text=Anderson had a number of football clients prior to his work with SEM and was the first agent to introduce foreign stars to the English Premier League , including Dennis Bergkamp , Marc Overmars and Uwe Rosler .
#Text=He represented nine of Arsenal ’ s 1989 title-winning side and has represented over 200 professional footballers .
#Text=Anderson has now retired from his position at SEM to focus on his other business interests .
#Text=He was at the forefront of the establishment of the charity The David Rocastle Trust , which helps to benefit families and communities .

#Text=In February 2009 , SEM formed a corporate partnership with Kentaro , a Swiss-based sports rights business who are among the major players in the international marketing of football television rights . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=Early career and involvement at Arsenal

#Text=Anderson trained as a banker and worked as a currency trader and in insurance , before beginning his career as Jerome Anderson Management in association with players from Arsenal F.C. , whom he had supported since he was four and where he had been the stadium announcer . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Among his early clients were the Arsenal players Charlie Nicholas [ 5 ] and David Rocastle . [ 4 ]
#Text="

#Text=Thaksin Shinawatra was regarded by a number of human rights groups as being an  unfit person " to own a Premier League football club .

column1: #Text=He was eventually deposed as Chairman by the Manchester City Board and forced to sell 90 % of his interest in the Club for £210m . [ 11 ]
#Text=Manchester City 's trading losses trebled during the full year in which Shinawatra was in control .

#Text=The introduction of new capital by Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan 's Abu Dhabi United Group Investment & Development Ltd saved the club after Shinawatra 's assets were frozen as part of the international investigation into corruption carried out by the Thai authorities . [ 12 ]
#Text=Blackburn Rovers

#Text=In 2010 , Anderson worked for Crescendo Sports Limited ( a company based in Brunei ) providing consultancy services for Venkateshwara Hatcheries in respect of their prospective acquisition of Blackburn Rovers .
#Text=After being a major advisor to Venky 's during their successful takeover in November 2010 , he continued to exert considerable influence on the club . [ 10 ]

#Text=After the Blackburn manager Sam Allardyce was sacked in December 2010 , Blackburn were forced to deny that the dispute had been based on the club 's transfer policy being set by the Kentaro sports agency , with whom Anderson 's SEM were associated . [ 2 ]
#Text=" Kentaro are our main consultants but Sam had the final call , " Venky 's chairwoman Anuradha Desai said . [ 2 ]
#Text=The new manager at Blackburn was Steve Kean , who had been first-team coach under Allardyce .
#Text=Kean was represented by Anderson , [ 13 ] who also introduced Kean 's new assistant , the former Arsenal player , John Jensen , to the club . [ 14 ]

#Text=When John Williams left Blackburn Rovers in February 2011 after 14 years as chairman , Anuradha Desai explained that the departure was in part due to the fact that he had " struggled to accept Jerome 's role at the club " . [ 15 ]

column1: #Text=In March 2011 , when it was announced that Anderson 's 21-year-old footballer son , Myles , had signed a precontract agreement with Blackburn , sources close to the agent insisted he had no day-to-day involvement at the club .
#Text=This has been heavily disputed by Rovers fans and others who saw damning evidence of foul play .

#Text=It was later revealed that Anderson had worked with agent Manuel Salamanca Ferrer to bring Rubén Rochina to Rovers for £400,000 , with the agent 's cut being £1.65m ( the cut would normally be around £170,000 for such a deal ) . [ 16 ]
